quests.title: Eco-Warriors of the Ganga
quests.description: A team of young environmentalists work together to reduce air and water pollution in their community, learning about sustainable practices and the importance of clean air and water.

story.title: The Ganga's Cry
story.caption:
A hazy afternoon in Agra.  Riya, Rohan, and Priya stand near the polluted Ganga river, saddened by the sight of trash and dirty water. They recall their class learning about the importance of clean water and air, and the impact of pollution on the environment and health. The air is thick with smog.  This scene highlights the real-world problem-solving aspect of NEP 2020.
Real-time context: 3 PM
Key sustainable actions: Reduce, Reuse, Recycle, Plant trees, Clean up litter
story.dialogue:
Riya: This is terrible! The Ganga is so polluted.
Rohan: And the air... it's hard to breathe!
Priya: We have to do something!
story.image_prompt: Three children aged 8-13, looking concerned, stand by a polluted river with trash visible. The sky is hazy with smog.  Warm, muted lighting. Use a comic book style.

story.title: A Plan Takes Shape
story.caption:
The children brainstorm solutions. They decide to create awareness about pollution in their school and community. They plan a school assembly, create posters about water and air pollution, and organize a community cleanup event. Joyful collaboration is a key element. 
Real-time context: Afternoon
Key sustainable actions: Community cleanup, Awareness campaign, Reduce carbon footprint
story.image_prompt: Split panel: 1. Children drawing posters about clean water and air. 2. Children giving a presentation at school. 3. Children cleaning up the riverbank.

story.title: Action!
story.caption:
The children present their project at school, inspiring other students to join their cause. This incorporates multidisciplinary learning. The community cleanup is a huge success!
Real-time context: Morning
Key sustainable actions: Community engagement, Waste segregation, Composting
story.image_prompt: Split panel: 1. Students listening attentively during the presentation. 2. Children planting trees. 3. Community members participating in the river cleanup.

story.title: Spreading the Word
story.caption:
The children create a short video about their project, sharing it online. They also write articles for the local newspaper. This highlights the multidisciplinary aspects of NEP 2020.
Real-time context: Evening
Key sustainable actions: Digital advocacy, Community education, Sustainable living
story.image_prompt: Split panel: 1. Children filming a video about their project. 2. Children creating a newspaper article. 3. Children sharing their video online.

story.title: A Cleaner Future
story.caption:
The river is visibly cleaner. The air quality has improved.  The children are proud and happy. They have made a measurable difference in their community.  They continue their efforts, inspiring others to join them. The scene showcases the hopeful, positive impact.
Real-time context: A sunny morning
Key sustainable actions: Environmental monitoring, Long-term commitment, Inspiring others
story.image_prompt: Split panel: 1. The cleaner Ganga river. 2. Children smiling, looking at the river. 3. A graph showing reduced pollution levels.

questions.question: What was the main environmental problem the children addressed in the story?
questions.explanation: The story focuses on the children's efforts to reduce air and water pollution in their community, inspired by the pollution affecting the Taj Mahal and Ganga river.

questions.question: Which of the following actions did the children NOT take to address the pollution?
options: Built a dam to stop the flow of polluted water
questions.explanation: While the children took many actions to combat pollution, building a dam was not mentioned in the story. Their focus was on community engagement, awareness, and direct cleanup.

questions.question: What was the positive outcome of the children's efforts?
options: They received a large sum of money
The river was visibly cleaner and the air quality improved
They moved to a new, cleaner city
